description: Schema for instruction conflict dataset used in RDIC semantic debate framework. Tests context isolation across multi-turn conversations with conflicting semantic constraints.

tone.name: Tone Conflicts
tone.description: Conflicts in formality, professionalism, or emotional tone that create incompatible semantic contexts

detail.name: Detail Conflicts
detail.description: Conflicts in level of detail or comprehensiveness that create different information density contexts

style.name: Style Conflicts
style.description: Conflicts in writing style or audience level that create incompatible presentation contexts

content.name: Content Conflicts
content.description: Conflicts in what information to include or exclude that create different content structure contexts

format.name: Format Conflicts
format.description: Conflicts in presentation structure or organization that create incompatible formatting contexts

example_structure.purpose: string (context_isolation_test - tests RDIC's ability to maintain separate semantic contexts)

turns.instruction: string (optional, user instruction/constraint that establishes a semantic context)
turns.query: string (optional, final query that requires accessing both semantic contexts)
turns.expected_behavior: string (optional, description of how RDIC should handle context isolation)
turns.rdic_value: string (optional, explanation of RDIC's value for preventing instruction degradation)

ground_truth_clusters: array of semantic constraint clusters that should remain isolated in separate KV contexts

metadata.restructured_at: ISO timestamp (if restructured from original format)

dataset_purpose.research_question: Can RDIC prevent instruction degradation by isolating conflicting semantic contexts in separate KV caches?
dataset_purpose.baseline_comparison: Without RDIC, KV compression causes later instructions to degrade earlier instructions. RDIC should maintain both contexts separately.
dataset_purpose.success_metric: System can access both instruction contexts when Turn 3 requests both versions

turn_structure_explanation.turn_1: Establishes first semantic context with specific instruction/constraint
turn_structure_explanation.turn_2: Establishes second, conflicting semantic context with different instruction
turn_structure_explanation.turn_3: Requests both contexts separately (e.g., 'Show me both versions'), testing if system maintained both contexts under KV compression
